DOC.brief_summary: This randomise controlled trial effect endometrial injury cycle precede frozen-thawed embryo transfer ( FET ) cycle . The study hypothesis endometrial injury increase ongoing pregnancy rate FET cycle .
DOC.brief_title: A RCT Effect Endometrial Injury Improving Ongoing Pregnancy Rate Subfertile Women Undergoing FET Cycles
DOC.detailed_description: Consecutive woman attend subfertility clinic Queen Mary Hospital , University Hong Kong schedule FET treatment recruit . Women normal uterine cavity randomize study control group 1 1 ratio accord computer-generated randomization list . For patient study group , cycle immediately precede schedule FET treatment , endometrial biopsy would arrange day 21-23 menstrual cycle instruct use non-hormonal mean contraception cycle . For patient control group , similar procedure would perform time precede cycle without enter uterine cavity , ie endometrial biopsy catheter enter endocervical canal without enter endometrial cavity . All patient proceed FET treatment next cycle schedule . The FET would carry per protocol . In short , patient attend clinic daily 18 day next expected period determination serum E2 luteinising hormone ( LH ) concentration LH surge , define day LH level 20 IU/L double average LH level past three day . For patient irregular menstrual cycle ovulation demonstrate natural cycle monitoring , clomiphene citrate ( CC , Clomid , Merrell , Staines , U.K. ) 50-100 mg give daily five day Days 3-7 . The cycle monitor blood test day 10 cycle . FET perform third day LH surge . Up two frozen-thawed embryo ( ) transfer . No luteal phase support use . On-going pregnancy rate , define viable fetus beyond 10-12 gestational week , two group compare . We measure endometrial thickness LH+1 natural clomid-induced cycle .
DOC.criteria: Undergoing FET treatment cycle Normal uterine cavity show transvaginal scanning saline sonogram do baseline endometrial thickness > =8mm stimulate IVF cycle FET cycle Pregnancy previous IVF FET cycle Presence hydrosalpinx surgically correct prior FET Presence endometrial polyp fibroid distort uterine cavity IVF cycle carry preimplantation genetic diagnosis Arrange blastocyst transfer Use donor oocyte
